name: Scallop and Oyster Stew
author: TerryWilson
summary: If you prefer, increase the amount of scallops and eliminate the oysters. If you prefer thinner stew, add another 1/2 cup milk.
ingredients: ⅓ cup peeled, seeded, and diced tomato
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat
Stir in the green onion, celery, and prosciutto; cover the pot and cook the mixture, stirring once, for 2 minutes
Stir the scallops and oysters with liquid into the green onion mixture; cook uncovered, stirring frequently, until the scallops are cooked through, about 5 minutes
Stir the corn, tomato, half-and-half, jalapeno pepper, sesame oil, and cilantro into the oyster mixture
Remove the pot from heat, cover, and allow the stew to sit until uniformly heated, about 10 minutes
Season with salt and pepper to serve
